blacklists.description: Blacklisting is a system that stops commands being run by a certain member, or in a certain channel.

blacklist.description: Toggle having a member, channel, or category blacklisted from running commands. Threads are not supported. Moderators can bypass channel blacklists, and Administrators can bypass member blacklists.

viewblacklist.description: View the currently blacklisted members, channels, and categories.

description: Custom commands are commands that you can configure to respond with whatever you want.
You can use "e!help custom" to view all the custom commands.

Custom command types:

Message: Will send a regular Discord message
Image/Gif/Video: Will send an image/gif/video in chat
Custom Embed: Will send a custom embed
URL Buttons: Will send a message containing some URL buttons

addcustomcommand.description: Run a builder that adds a new custom command for the server.

removecustomcommand.description: Remove a custom command from the server.

rolerequirements.description: Role requirements are a system where users must have a certain role to be able to use commands.

addrolerequirement.description: Limit a command to only be used by members with a certain role. You can set up to 5 roles per command. Members only need one of the roles to be able to use it.

removerolerequirements.description: Remove a role from being a requirement of a command.

viewrolerequirements.description: View the role requirements set up in the current server.

disable.description: Toggle a category/command being disabled in the current server.

description: Get a list of the bot's commands and information about each one.

Argument types:

[arg] - A text argument
<arg> - A discord feature (mentions, emojis, etc...)
{arg} - A file argument

prefixlessmode.description: Toggle allowing commands to not need a prefix when used in direct messages.

description: View the number of times a command has been used.
Don't provide a command to view the top 10 most used commands.

summary.description: Get a summary of the most popular commands of the day/week.

viewdisabled.description: View which categories/commands are disabled in the current server.

viewwhitelist.description: View which categories/commands are whitelisted in the current server.

whitelist.description: Toggle a category/command being whitelisted in the current server. Whitelisting a category/command allows it to bypass being disabled by a parent category.

description: Change the prefix for the bot in the current server.
Set the prefix to "default", "normal", or "reset" to return it back to the default prefix.

prefixalias.description: Add or remove a custom prefix alias. A prefix alias is an alternate prefix that can be used without overwriting the main prefix.

togglequotes.description: Toggles whether the bot will quote a message whenever a message link is sent.

bugreport.description: Submit a bug report for the bot.

contact.description: Get a list of ways to contact the bot developer.

discord.description: Get the invite link for the bot creators Discord server.

donate.description: Get some links where you can donate to the bot developer to show your support!

description: Change the bots embed colour on the current server.
The embed colour is the coloured bar down the side of each message.
Set the colour to "default" to return it to the default colour.

ewan.description: Get a link to the bot creators website.

description: Export the data that the bot has stored about you or the server.

Types:
- User
- Server

info.description: Get some information about the bot.

ping.description: Check what the bot's latency is.

privacy.description: View the privacy policy for the bot.

resendjoininfo.description: Resend the message the bot sends when it joins the message in the current channel.

description: Reset the bot to its default state on this server as well as clearing any files related to this server.

WARNING:
This will remove any saved data, including moderation log. There is no way to recover this data.

servers.description: Show the top 10 biggest servers that the bot is in.

suggest.description: Make a suggestion for the bot.

support.description: Get support for the bot. Just send your message in the command and we will get back to you as soon as possible!

terms.description: View the terms of service for the bot.

website.description: Get a link to the bots website.

description: Play Connect 4 against another member.
The maximum board size is 21x15

rockpaperscissors.description: Play Rock Paper Scissors against the bot or another member! Mention a member to play against them.

description: Play Tic Tac Toe against the bot or another member! Mention a member to play against them.

Difficulties:

easy
medium
hard
expert

8ball.description: Ask the magic eight-ball a question.

bubblewrap.description: Create some bubblewrap with a hidden message!

dice.description: Roll some dice! You can roll a total of 1 to 6 dice in one go.

flow.description: Generate an "inspirational" flow of images and quotes.

hate.description: Discover how much you hate someone/something!

description: Get the bot to tell a joke.
NSFW jokes will only occur in NSFW channels.
Kill a user with a Minecraft death message.
"<member>" and "[weapon]" are optional.

love.description: Discover how much you love someone/something!

mock.description: Convert some text to CoNsTaNtLy sWiTcHiNg cAsEs.

monketest.description: Test how much of a monkey someone is!

description: These commands take many types of image inputs.

Valid image types:

- Attachment
- URL
- Member
- Emoji
- Sticker
Leave it blank to target an image/url/emoji/sticker from a previous message in the channel. You can reply to a message to target an image in that message.
images.extra:
There are certain image prefixes and shortcuts that you can use to change the image input.

These work on any command that accepts a member, or an image:
^  - Target the member from the previous message
<  - Target yourself
me - Target yourself
<< - Target your user (will ignore server avatar and get main avatar)

These work on any command that accepts an image:
b:@ping          - get a users banner
u:@ping          - get a user instead of a member (will ignore server avatar and get main avatar)
mc:username      - get the minecraft skin of a Minecraft username
mc:@ping         - get the minecraft skin of a member
skin:username    - get the minecraft skin of a Minecraft username
skin:@ping       - get the minecraft skin of a member
cape:username    - get the minecraft cape of a Minecraft username
cape:@ping       - get the minecraft cape of a member
texture:filename - get a minecraft texture

boomerang.description: Make a gif play forwards, then backwards, in a loop.

combinegif.description: Combine two gifs so that one plays after the other.

description: Get a specific frame of a gif.
Leave frame blank to show how many frames a gif has.
"first" gives the first frame, and "last" gives the last frame.

reverse.description: Make a gif play in reverse.

spritesheet.description: Turn an animated GIF into a spritesheet of its frames.

ellipse.description: Draw a ellipse on an image.

floodfill.description: Floodfill an area on an image.

line.description: Draw a line on an image.

pixel.description: Add a single pixel to an image.

polygon.description: Draw a regular polygon on an image.

rectangle.description: Draw a rectangle on an image.

text.description:
Write some text over an image.
"Put an argument inside quotation marks to use spaces".
The "align" options are "center", "left", and "right"

description: Blur an image.
The amount defaults to 10.
Change the brightness of an image.
The brightness is a range of -100 to 100.
Convert an image to a different colour mode.

Available modes:

1 - 1 bit colour
L - Greyscale
LA - Greyscale with alpha
RGB - Colour
RGBA - Colour with alpha
Copy the palette of one image to another image.

Max number of colours is 256.

The colours are copied from the first image to the second image.

hueshift.description: Change the hue of an image. Defaults to 180Â°

description: Limit an images colour palette to a provided amount.
Defaults to 10 colours.
Use the transparency of one image as a mask for another image.

Modes:

- inside
- outside

multiply.description: Multiply an image by a colour.

neon.description: Apply a sobel edge detection filter to an image.

normalise.description: Enhance output image contrast by stretching its luminance to cover the full dynamic range.

recolour.description: Recolour an image to a specific colour, keeping the opacity.

sepia.description: Apply a sepia filter to an image.

description: Convert an image to black and white, based on a threshold.
The threshold is a range of 0 to 255.
Any pixel value greater than or equal to the threshold value will be set to 255, otherwise it will be set to 0.

avatarpie.description: Merge a bunch of avatars into one image.

description: Throw a birthday party for someone!
If members are not specified, random members from the server will be picked.
The birthday member will always be Wynem on "26/7".

kickface.description: Kick a member in the face!

monkey.description: Turn some members into a group of monkeys!

monkeyband.description: Turn some members into a band of monkeys!

snap.description: Snap a user out of existence.

billboard.description: Put an image onto a billboard in New York.

gallery.description: Put an image into an art gallery.

linus.description: Put an image into Linus Sebastian's hands

description: Put images/text into a heart shaped locket.

If the "beloved" alias is used, the formatting changes to:
e!beloved {user}

salute.description: Put an image onto a flag that is being saluted.

samepicture.description: Show that two images are the same picture.

scottthewoz.description: Put an image onto Scott Wozniak's TV.

spongebob.description: Put an image into Spongebob's hands.

trump.description: Put an image into Donald Trump's hands.

bulge.description: Apply a bulge or a pinch effect to an image.

gmagick.description: Content aware scales an image. Outputs a GIF.

magick.description: Content aware scales an image. Outputs a static image.

twist.description: Apply a twist effect to an image.

animeeyes.description: Place anime eyes over someones face!

bulgeface.description: Apply a bulge or a pinch effect to a face.

dealwithit.description: Place MLG glasses over someones face!

detectface.description: Detect a face in an image

description: Apply makeup to someone's face!

Default colours:

Lips:             #960000
Inner Eye Shadow: #4b88de
Outer Eye Shadow: #00ff84

steveface.description: Place Steve or Alex's face over someones face!

trollface.description: Place a trollface over someones face!

description: Make an image hold a gun.
"expand" and "double" are true/false.
"expand" puts the gun over the edge of the image
Shoot an image.
"expand" and "double" are true/false.
"expand" puts the gun over the edge of the image

speechbubble.description: Add a speech bubble to an image

description: Add a thinking hand to an image.
"expand" and "double" are true/false.
"expand" puts the hand over the edge of the image.

breakingnews.description: Add a breaking news bar to an image.

caption.description: Add a caption to an image.

discordmessage.description: Generate a discord message. Use quotes around arguments to use more than one word. Set "botTag" to "false" to disable it.

notification.description: Add a custom Discord notification to an image.

description: Add Peter Griffin to an image.
Use "peter2" to put him on the opposite side.
Add the "Sneak 100" image to the bottom of an image.
The text is customisable.
Add Robert Downey Jr. to an image.
Use "stuff2" to put him on the opposite side.

tombstone.description: Put some text on a tombstone.

description: Add some text to the top, middle, or bottom of an image.
Defaults to the top of the image
Use the middle or bottom aliases to put the text in the middle or on the bottom.

valentines.description: Generate a minecraft valentines image for that special someone in your life.

description: Turn an image into Minecraft block art!

Possible modes:
- all
- metal
- planks
- plants
- side
- sidesurvival
- solid
- stone
- top
- topsurvival
- wood
- wool
Turn two images into one image, where it shows a different one depending on if you are using dark mode or light mode
The first image will be visible while in dark mode, the second while in light mode.

dumpy.description: Make an image into an Among Us Dumpy gif!

emojify.description: Turn an image into a bunch of emojis! Available modes are "default" and "all".

description: Hide an image in plain sight.

Colour modes:
- dark
- light
Create a custom Among Us character!

The colours in order are:

outline, hair, head, visor, body, backpack, leftLeg, rightLeg

jpegify.description: Turn an image into a crusty JPEG. The quality is a number in the range 0 - 100

rainbow.description: Make an image cycle through the rainbow!

description: Apply a time warp scan effect to a gif.
"switchAxis" and "reverse" are both true/false.

squarify.description: Squarifies an image. The first number is the square size, the second is the size of the gap between each square.

textify.description: Turn an image into ascii art using the braille characters. Available modes are "average" and "edge".

description: Apply a delay warp effect to a gif.
"switchAxis" and "reverse" are both true/false.
Create a custom Wynem logo!

vCol  - Vertical bar colour
hCol  - Horizontal bar colour
bgCol - Background colour
sCol  - Shadow colour

generategradient.description: Generate a gradient from a colour, with hue shifting.

generatepalette.description: Generate a palette of random colours.

readqrcode.description: Read a QR code in an image.

save.description: Turn an image into a gif so that you can save it to your Discord favourites list.

description: Put a watermark over an image.
Use the "watermarkimage" alias to use an image as a watermark instead of the text.

background.description: Set the background colour for an image with transparency.

crop.description: Crop out a region of an image.

opacity.description: Change the opacity of an image.

description: Overlay an image on top of another image, filling the entire selected location.
"stretch" is a true/false that controls whether the overlayed image will be stretched to fill the location.

Locations:
- full

- bottom
- left
- right
- topleft
- topright

square.description: Add transparent padding to an image to make it a square.

hooh.description: Flip the bottom half of an image to the top half.

toot.description: Mirror the top right half of an image to the bottom left half.

waaw.description: Mirror the left half of an image to the right half.

woow.description: Mirror the right half of an image to the left half.

description: Append one image onto another image.
Scaling is a true/false that will resize the appended image to be the same size.

Available directions:

- Top
- Left
- Right
- Bottom

averagecolour.description: Get the average colour of an image.

decodemessage.description: Decode an image which has a message encoded in the pixel values.

description: Get the image of an emoji.
The type or resolution is optional. Not every type has every emoji.

encodemessage.description: Create an image from a message, which is encoded as pixel values.

description: Extract a colour channel from an image.

Available channels:

 - Red

- Blue
- Alpha

getimage.description: Get an image. This can be used to show what image would be used in an image command. This can also be used to convert videos into gifs.

gradient.description: Generate a gradient from a list of colours.

description: Compare two images, to see the differences between them.

Red: Removed pixels
Green: New pixels
Blue: Edited pixels

imagesize.description: View the dimentions of an image.

outline.description: Add an outline to an image.

palette.description: Show the palette of an image

replacecolour.description: Replace a colour in an image.

description: Make an image round by cutting off the corners.
The size can either be a number of pixels, or a percentage of the width and height of the image.

sticker.description: View a sticker. Animated stickers are converted to gifs.

cem.description: Get a list of bone names for each entity supported by OptiFine CEM

chestconverter.description: Convert chests between the 1.14 and 1.15 format.

ctmconverter.description: Convert compact CTM to full CTM or overlay CTM.

ctmpreviewer.description: Generate a preview image for full CTM.

ctmsplitter.description: Split a CTM template image up into its individual images for use with OptiFine CTM.

minecraftassets.description: Get a link to download the Minecraft assets of a specific version.

minecrafttitleconverter.description: Convert an image into a Minecraft title texture for use in a resource pack.

mojangconverter.description: Convert between the 1.15 and 1.16 Mojang logo formats.

rendermodel.description: Render an image/images onto a 3D model. Run without any arguments to see the list of supported models.

tile.description: Tile an image over a 5x5 area. Provide a custom width and height to customise the size.

versiondifference.description: Get a link to quickly compare the assets of 2 versions of Minecraft against eachother. Saying "latest" will automatically compare the newest 2 versions.

cape.description: View the cape and elytra of a Minecraft Java edition player.

head.description: View the head of a Minecraft Java edition player.

mckick.description: Make one minecraft player kick another minecraft player!

description: Make a 2D preview for a skin texture.
The format is either "steve" or "alex"
Render a minecraft skin in 3D.

Formats:

- player
- round
- spin
- flop
- back
- wave
- squish
- head

skin.description: View the skin of a Minecraft Java edition player.

skinconverter.description: Convert between the new and old Minecraft skin formats.

skinify.description: Turn any image into a minecraft skin.

mcaccount.description: View the minecraft account tied to someones discord.

minecraftwiki.description: Search for something on the Minecraft Wiki.

mojangtext.description: Generate some text in the Mojang font. This can be used for the loading screen in Minecraft if used with the "e!mojangconverter" command.

optifine.description: Get a link to download the latest OptiFine version.

setmcaccount.description:
Tie a minecraft account to your Discord, so you can run the Minecraft commands without specifying a user.

Leave blank to remove your account.

description: Moderator pings are a system that allow members to quickly and easily get the attention of moderators for whatever reason is necessary.

During a mod ping, Wynem will ping three members of the lowest ranking moderator role, with 60 seconds between each ping. If no moderator has responded, it will ping the entire role. If still no one has responded, it repeats this process two more times with the next two heigher tiers of moderator role.
By default, moderator role tiers are guessed, but they can be manually configured with the "setmodpingroles" command.
Modpings can also be triggered by pinging any role named "@Modping" or "@Moderator Ping"

modping.description: Ping the moderators of the current server. The roles can be configured with the "setmodpingroles" command

setmodpingroles.description: Set up to three custom roles to be used with moderator pings. The order of the roles is the order of priority. Running this will overwrite any previously set roles. Provide no roles to remove the current ones.

togglemodping.description: Toggles the ability for users to trigger a moderator ping.

description: Add a note to a member.
Members cannot see their notes.
The note is stored as a record and can be viewed at any time. There is a maximum of 50 records per member.
Ban a user from the server.
The user is sent a message saying they were banned, along with the reason.

endtimeout.description: End the time out of a member who is timed out.

description: Kick a member from the server.
The member is sent a message saying they were kicked, along with the reason.
Bulk delete messages from a channel.
Defaults to 5, maximum 99.
Mention a user to delete only their messages.
This cannot delete messages that are over two weeks old.

records.description: View the moderation records for a member.

description: Give a member a time out so that they cannot type or speak.
Defaults to 10 minutes.
The member is sent a message saying they were timed out, along with the reason.
The time out is stored as a record and can be viewed at any time. There is a maximum of 50 records per member.

unban.description: Unban a user from the server.

description: Give a member a warning.
The member is sent a message saying they were warned, along with the reason.
The warning is stored as a record and can be viewed at any time. There is a maximum of 50 records per member.

artchives.description: The Artchiveâ¢ is a channel where users can submit images to be archived. These could be artworks, memes, or literally anything. Its up to each server to decide what to use it for.

artchive.description: Add an image to the Artchive! Requires an image attachment.

setartchive.description: Set the channel were submissions from the "artchive" command will be sent.

description: Auto-responses are a way to make the bot respond to triggers in regular messages.

Triggers have four modes: full, contains, words ordered, and words unordered.

Full mode will only match if the entire message is the same as the trigger.

Contains mode will match if the message contains the trigger anywhere inside it.

Words ordered mode will match as long as the message contains all the trigger's words in it, in the order that they were provided.

Words unordered mode will match as long as the message contains all the trigger's words in it. The order the words appear in doesn't matter.

For both words modes, other words can appear in between the required words.

Auto-response types:

Message: Will send a regular Discord message
Image/Gif/Video: Will send an image/gif/video in chat
Custom Embed: Will send a custom embed
URL Buttons: Will send a message containing some URL buttons
Emoji Reactions: Will react to the message with some emoji reactions

addautoresponse.description: Run a builder that adds a new auto-response for the server.

description: Remove an auto-response from the server.
Provide no arguments to view a list of active auto-responses.
View an auto-response from the server.
Provide no arguments to view a list of active auto-responses.

close.description: Close the current thread channel or forum post.

lock.description: Toggle everyone's ability to send messages in the current channel.

repin.description: Re-pin a message to move it to the top of the channel pins.

description: Set a channel to display the current number of members in the server.
Any channel type can be used except for Threads.
Use <count> in the text to incicate where the count should go.
Example:`e!setmembercounter #channelname Member Count: <count>

slowmode.description: Set a custom slowmode for the current channel.

addemoji.description: Add an emoji to the server.

removeemoji.description: Remove an emoji from the server.

faqs.description: The FAQ is a system to store frequently asked questions, so that you can quickly bring up the answers when they are asked.

addfaq.description: Run a builder that adds a new FAQ for the server. There is a maximum of 25 FAQs per server.

editfaq.description: Run a builder that adds a new FAQ for the server. There is a maximum of 25 FAQs per server.

faqdetails.description: Get the full details about a certain faq.

removefaq.description: Remove an FAQ from the server.

setjoindm.description: Set a message that is sent to members through DM when they join the server.

setjoinimage.description: Set the image that will be used with the join message. "default" will set it back to the default image.

setjoinmessage.description: Set a channel to send an image with a message when a member joins the server. The message is in the format [message] <member>, where you set the message part.

setleaveimage.description: Set the image that will be used with the leave message. "default" will set it back to the default image.

setleavemessage.description: Set a channel to send an image with a message when a member leaves the server. The message is in the format [message] <member>, where you set the message part.

viewjoinmessages.description: View what the current servers join messages are.

managelogs.description: Manage the bot logs for the server.

viewlogs.description: View the bot log channels for the server.

addrole.description: Add a role to a member.

description: Run a builder that sets up a message that members can use to to add roles to themselves.
For the role text, provide "none" to leave it blank.

Role types:

Normal  - The user can add and remove this role as they wish
Binding - Once the role is applied, it cannot be removed
Unique  - You can only have one unique role at a time
Add or remove a role that users will gain when joining the server.
Provide no arguments to view the current join roles.

removerole.description: Remove a role from a member.

linkserver.description:
Link a server to the current server, sharing bot settings, moderation logs, timeouts, kicks, and bans.

The current server will become the parent server, and any linked servers will become child servers.

unlinkserver.description: Unlink a server from the current server.

viewserverlinks.description: View the current server links of the current server.

addstarboardblacklist.description: Blacklist a category or channel from having its messages sent to the starboard.

removestarboardblacklist.description: Remove a category or channel from being blacklisted from the starboard.

description: Set a channel to use as a starboard for the server.
A starboard is a channel where messages are sent after they reach a certain number of a reaction, usually a star.
Set a channel to use as a starboard for the server.
A starboard is a channel where messages are sent after they reach a certain number of a reaction, usually a star.

namesearch.description: Search for users with certain text in their name.

serverinfo.description: Get some infomation about the current server.

avatar.description: Show a users avatar, with links to get it in different resolutions.

joinposition.description: View the position that a member joined the server in. To search by placement instead of a member, enter a number. When a member who joined before you leaves, you will move up the list.

userinfo.description: Get info about a specified user.

repeatingreminder.description: Set a reminder for yourself that repeats at a regular interval.

viewreminders.description: View and remove your existing reminders. If you have the "Moderate Members" permission, you can view and remove other users reminders, or the reminders in a certain channel.

white

Messages will not be read for users who not in the voice channel, or if the message starts with a URL.

setttslanguage.description: Set a default language for your TTS to be read in.

description: Read some text out loud. If you are in a voice channel, the bot will join the channel and read it out loud there, otherwise it sends an mp3.
The [language] is optional. The language must be inside [] for it to register. Run the command without any text to see the available languages.
Add "[file]" at the start of the message to send it as an mp3 while you are in a voice channel.

ocho

discord.description: Get the invite link for the bot creators Discord server.

donate.description: Get some links where you can donate to the bot developer to show your support!

ewan.description: Get a link to the bot creators website.

exportdata.description: Export the data that the bot has stored about you or the server.

options.name: type
options.description: The type of data to export (user/server)

info.description: Get some information about the bot.

privacy.description: View the privacy policy for the bot.

servers.description: Show the top 10 biggest servers that the bot is in.

suggest.description: Make a suggestion for the bot.

support.description: Get support for the bot. Run the command and we will get back to you as soon as possible!

terms.description: View the terms of service for the bot.

website.description: Get a link to the bots website.

lock.description: Toggle everyone's ability to send messages in the current channel.

repin.description: Re-pin a message to move it to the top of the channel pins.

options.name: message
options.description: The message ID or URL to re-pin

slowmode.description: Set a custom slowmode for the current channel.

description: Play Connect 4 against another member.
The maximum board size is 21x15

rockpaperscissors.description: Play Rock Paper Scissors against the bot or another member! Mention a member to play against them.

description: Play Tic Tac Toe against the bot or another member! Mention a member to play against them.

Difficulties:

easy
medium
hard
expert

options.name: difficulty
options.description: The difficulty of the AI (if no member provided)

8ball.description: Ask the magic eight-ball a question.

bubblewrap.description: Create some bubblewrap with a hidden message!

dice.description: Roll some dice! You can roll a total of 1 to 6 dice in one go.

flow.description: Generate an "inspirational" flow of images and quotes.

hate.description: Discover how much you hate someone/something!

description: Get the bot to tell a joke.
NSFW jokes will only occur in NSFW channels.
Kill a user with a Minecraft death message.
"<member>" and "[weapon]" are optional.

love.description: Discover how much you love someone/something!

mock.description: Convert some text to CoNsTaNtLy sWiTcHiNg cAsEs.

monketest.description: Test how much of a monkey someone is!

options.name: delay
options.description: The amount of delay between each frame

boomerang.description: Make a gif play forwards, then backwards, in a loop.

combinegif.description: Combine two gifs so that one plays after the other.

description: Get a specific frame of a gif.
Leave frame blank to show how many frames a gif has.
"first" gives the first frame, and "last" gives the last frame.

options.name: frame
options.description: The frame to get. Can be a number

reverse.description: Make a gif play in reverse.

spritesheet.description: Turn an animated GIF into a spritesheet of its frames.

daad.description: Mirror the top left half of an image to the bottom right half.

dood.description: Mirror the bottom right half of an image to the top left half.

haah.description: Flip the top half of an image to the bottom half.

hooh.description: Flip the bottom half of an image to the top half.

taat.description: Mirror the bottom left half of an image to the top right half.

toot.description: Mirror the top right half of an image to the bottom left half.

waaw.description: Mirror the left half of an image to the right half.

woow.description: Mirror the right half of an image to the left half.

description: Extract a colour channel from an image.

Available channels:

 - Red
 - Green
- Blue
- Alpha

mergechannels.description: Merge three images into a single image, using each image as the individual colour channels.

options.name: red-image-attachment
options.description: The image to use as the red colour channel

options.name: red-image-string
options.description: The image to use as the red colour channel

options.name: green-image-attachment
options.description: The image to use as the green colour channel

options.name: green-image-string
options.description: The image to use as the green colour channel

options.name: blue-image-attachment
options.description: The image to use as the blue colour channel

options.name: blue-image-string
options.description: The image to use as the blue colour channel

description: Blur an image.
The amount defaults to 10.

options.name: amount
options.description: The amount to blur the image

description: Change the brightness of an image.
The brightness is a range of -100 to 100.

options.name: amount
options.description: The amount to brighten the image by

description: Convert an image to a different colour mode.

Available modes:

1 - 1 bit colour
L - Greyscale
LA - Greyscale with alpha
RGB - Colour
RGBA - Colour with alpha
Copy the palette of one image to another image.

Max number of colours is 256.

The colours are copied from the first image to the second image.

options.name: source-attachment
options.description: The image to get the colours from

options.name: source-string
options.description: The image to get the colours from

options.name: image-attachment
options.description: The image to apply the colours to

options.name: image-string
options.description: The image to apply the colours to

hueshift.description: Change the hue of an image. Defaults to 180Â°

options.name: angle
options.description: The angle to hue shift the image

description: Limit an images colour palette to a provided amount.
Defaults to 10 colours.

options.name: count
options.description: The number of colours to limit the image to

description: Use the transparency of one image as a mask for another image.

Modes:

- inside
- outside

options.name: mask-attachment
options.description: The image to use as a mask

options.name: mask-string
options.description: The image to use as a mask

multiply.description: Multiply an image by a colour.

neon.description: Apply a sobel edge detection filter to an image.

normalise.description: Enhance output image contrast by stretching its luminance to cover the full dynamic range.

recolour.description: Recolour an image to a specific colour, keeping the opacity.

sepia.description: Apply a sepia filter to an image.

description: Convert an image to black and white, based on a threshold.
The threshold is a range of 0 to 255.
Any pixel value greater than or equal to the threshold value will be set to 255, otherwise it will be set to 0.

avatarpie.description: Merge a bunch of avatars into one image.

description: Throw a birthday party for someone!
If members are not specified, random members from the server will be picked.
The birthday member will always be Wynem on "26/7".

kickface.description: Kick a member in the face!

monkey.description: Turn some members into a group of monkeys!

monkeyband.description: Turn some members into a band of monkeys!

snap.description: Snap a user out of existence.

description: Add some text to the top, middle, or bottom of an image.
Defaults to the top of the image
Use the middle or bottom aliases to put the text in the middle or on the bottom.

breakingnews.description: Add a breaking news bar to an image.

options.name: text
options.description: The text to put on the sign

caption.description: Add a caption to an image.

options.name: text
options.description: The text to put on the sign

options.name: username
options.description: The username of the user sending the message

options.name: bot-tag
options.description: The text for the bot tag

notification.description: Add a custom Discord notification to an image.

description: Add Peter Griffin to an image.
Use "peter2" to put him on the opposite side.

options.name: text
options.description: The text for Peter to say

options.name: sideswap
options.description: Swap the side Peter is on

description: Add the "Sneak 100" image to the bottom of an image.
The text is customisable.
Add Robert Downey Jr. to an image.
Use "stuff2" to put him on the opposite side.

options.name: text
options.description: The text for Robert to say

options.name: sideswap
options.description: Swap the side Robert is on

tombstone.description: Put some text on a tombstone.

options.name: text
options.description: The text to put on the tombstone

valentines.description: Generate a minecraft valentines image for that special someone in your life.

background.description: Set the background colour for an image with transparency.

crop.description: Crop out a region of an image.

options.name: x
options.description: The top left X coordinate of the crop region

options.name: y
options.description: The top left Y coordinate of the crop region

options.name: width
options.description: The width of the crop region

options.name: height
options.description: The height of the crop region

opacity.description: Change the opacity of an image.

description: Overlay an image on top of another image, filling the entire selected location.
"stretch" is a true/false that controls whether the overlayed image will be stretched to fill the location.

Locations:
- full
- top
- bottom
- left
- right
- topleft
- topright
- bottomleft
- bottomright

options.name: location
options.description: The location to overlay the image

options.name: stretch
options.description: If the overlay should be stretched to fill

description: Add padding to the sides of an image.

Available directions:

- All
- Top
- Left
- Right
- Bottom

options.name: size
options.description: The amount of pixels to pad

options.name: direction
options.description: The direction to apply the padding

paste.description: Paste an image onto another image.

options.name: x
options.description: The x location of the pasted image

options.name: y
options.description: The y location of the pasted image

options.name: width
options.description: The width of the pasted image

options.name: height
options.description: The height of the pasted image

resize.description: Resize an image to a desired size. Interpolation modes only work on static images.

options.name: width
options.description: The new width of the image

options.name: height
options.description: The new height of the image

options.name: interpolation
options.description: The interpolation to use for the resize (static images only)

options.name: degrees
options.description: The degrees to rotate the image

scale.description: Scale an image up to the max size discord displays images, making it easier to view small images.

square.description: Add transparent padding to an image to make it a square.

trim.description: Remove the transparent pixels from the edge of an image.

description: Put a watermark over an image.
Use the "watermarkimage" alias to use an image as a watermark instead of the text.

options.name: text
options.description: The text to draw over the image as the watermark

options.name: image-attachment
options.description: The image to draw the watermark over

options.name: image-string
options.description: The image to draw the watermark over

options.name: watermark-image-attachment
options.description: The image use as a watermark instead of text

options.name: watermark-image-string
options.description: The image use as a watermark instead of text

tile.description: Tile an image over a 5x5 area.

skin.description: View the skin of a Minecraft Java edition player.

addnote.description: Add a note to a member. Notes are stored as a record.

options.name: member
options.description: The member to add the note too

endtimeout.description: End the time out of a member who is timed out.

options.name: member
options.description: The member to end the timeout of

options.name: reason
options.description: The reason for ending the timeout

records.description: View the moderation records for a member.

options.name: member
options.description: The member to view the records of

addrole.description: Add a role to a member.

options.name: member
options.description: The member to add the role to

options.name: role
options.description: The role to add to the member

removerole.description: Remove a role from a member.

options.name: member
options.description: The member to remove the role from

options.name: role
options.description: The role to remove from the member

faqdetails.description: Get the full details about a certain faq.

info.description: Get some infomation about the current server.

addautoresponse.description: Run a builder that adds a new auto-response for the server.

description: Remove an auto-response from the server.
Provide no arguments to view a list of active auto-responses.
View an auto-response from the server.
Provide no arguments to view a list of active auto-responses.

addcustomcommand.description: Run a builder that adds a new custom command for the server.

removecustomcommand.description: Remove a custom command from the server.

addfaq.description: Run a builder that adds a new FAQ for the server. There is a maximum of 25 FAQs per server.

editfaq.description: Run a builder that adds a new FAQ for the server. There is a maximum of 25 FAQs per server.

removefaq.description: Remove an FAQ from the server.

manage.description: Manage the bot logs for the server.

view.description: View the bot log channels for the server.

prefix.description: Change the prefix for the bot in the current server.

prefixalias.description: Add/remove a custom prefix alias. This is an alternative prefix you can use instead of the main one.

options.name: prefix
options.description: The custom prefix alias to add or remove

description: Run a builder that sets up a message that members can use to to add roles to themselves.
For the role text, provide "none" to leave it blank.

Role types:

Normal  - The user can add and remove this role as they wish
Binding - Once the role is applied, it cannot be removed
Unique  - You can only have one unique role at a time
Add or remove a role that users will gain when joining the server.
Provide no arguments to view the current join roles.

options.name: role
options.description: The role to add to the member

quotes.description: Toggles whether the bot will quote a message whenever a message link is sent.

resendjoininfo.description: Resend the message the bot sends when it joins the message in the current channel.

avatar.description: Show a users avatar, with links to get it in different resolutions.

options.name: user
options.description: The user to get the avatar of

info.description: Get info about a specified user.

options.name: user
options.description: The user to get the information of

joinposition.description: View the position that a member joined the server in.

options.name: member
options.description: The member to get the join position of

options.name: position
options.description: The join position to get the member of

description: Preview a colour. This also converts it to a variety of different colour formats.

Available input types:

white
#FFF
#FFF8
#FFFFFF
#FFFFFF80
rgb(255,255,255)
rgba(255,255,255,0.5)
hsl(0,0%,100%)
hsla(0,0%,100%,0.5)

options.name: colour
options.description: The colour to preview. HEX codes supported

createembed.description: Run a builder to create and send a custom embed.

exif.description: View the exif data of a file.

filesize.description: View the file size of a file.

options.name: file-url
options.description: The file URL to check the file size of

getrawmessage.description: Get the raw text content of a discord message.

options.name: message-url
options.description: The message URL to get the raw content of

google.description: Make a Google Search link for when people ask questions they could have easily searched themselves.

poll.description: Run a builder that sets up a poll that members can vote on.

leave.description: Make the bot leave the current voice channel.

tts.description: Read some text out loud. If in a voice channel, the bot will join the channel and speak it out loud.

options.name: message
options.description: The message to read out loud

options.name: language
options.description: The language to read the message in

ban.description: Ban a user from the server.

close.description: Close the current thread channel or forum post.

help.description: Get a list of the bots commands and information about each one.

kick.description: Kick a member from the server.

modping.description: Ping the moderators of the current server.

ping.description: Check what the bot's latency is.

purge.description: Bulk delete messages from a channel. Defaults to 5, maximum 99.

options.name: limit
options.description: The number of messages to purge

options.name: member
options.description: The member whose messages to purge

timeout.description: Give a member a time out so that they cannot type or speak.

unban.description: Unban a user from the server.

get-avatar.description: Show a users avatar, with links to get it in different resolutions.

ban-member.description: Ban a user from the server.

kick-member.description: Kick a member from the server.

user-information.description: Get info about a specified user.

get-raw-message.description: Get the raw text content of a discord message.

re-pin-message.name: Re-pin Message
re-pin-message.description: Re-pin a message to move it to the top of the channel pins.

resize-image.description: Resize an image to a desired size.

options.name: Width
options.description: The width of the resized image

options.name: Height
options.description: The height of the resized image

options.name: Interpolation
options.description: The interpolation method for the resize

scale-image.description: Scale an image up to the max size discord displays images, making it easier to view small images.
